member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.TerminalInitializedEventHandler
member.summary: Event handler delegate for session started event.
member.param: An AsyncCompletedEventArgs type that contains an Error property that indicates which error (if any) occurred during the InitInstance call.

member.name: T:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl
member.summary: Renders the Open Systems Graphics terminal emulator. The session details can be configured through the Terminal property.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of an OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl. This user interface control can be used in .NET based applications to render a terminal emulation user interface.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.GetDesignMode
member.summary: This rountine will properly query for process for design time or not. This works even in constructor vs. this.DesignMode property from this control. The creation and dispose of the process also ensures there is no memory leaks.
member.returns: True if this control is within the VS designer process else false.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.InitInstance
member.summary: Initializes this terminal instance.
member.remarks: The InitInstance call is required to initialize the terminal user control prior to use.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.InitInstance(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes this terminal instance with an existing session file.
member.remarks: The InitInstance call is required to initialize the terminal user control with sufficient information to render a terminal user interface.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.OnTerminalInitCompleted(System.ComponentModel.AsyncCompletedEventArgs)
member.summary: Called after session has started. After the session is started it should be visible if actually connected to the host and blank, ready to connect, if not yet connected to the host.
member.param: An AsyncCompletedEventArgs that contains an Error property that contains an error that occurred during InitInstance call.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.StartTerminalInstanceAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Start the core frame workspace instance. This will also start the terminal session instance within the frame that will reference the already started terminal instance.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.StartTerminalInstanceCore(System.String,System.ComponentModel.AsyncOperation)
member.summary: This routine actually starts the Frame process. It also registers listeners to the main application main menu strip. This is to listen to Menu activate and deactive messages. When Menu is activated then the focus is placed on the control MenuStrip. This same scenario needs to be done to all MenuStrip and ContextMenuStrip that is used in the customer application to ensure focus switches between the controls and the internal out-of-proc activex control.
member.param: An object that tracks the lifetime of an asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.StopTerminalInstanceCore
member.summary: Stops the terminal instance.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.StartFrameWorkspace(System.String)
member.summary: Start the Frame workspace instance (Attachmate.Emuation.Frame.exe) given the workspace instance name.
member.returns: True, if terminal frame instance started and ready, else false

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.AxRwinCtrlGotFocus(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: When this control gets focus, generate a left button down on the TUC control in order for outstanding MentuStrip to close if they happened to be in dropped view state.
member.param: An System.EventArgs that contains no event data.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.MainMenuStripMenuActivate(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Event triggered when main form menu strip has been activated.
member.param: MenuStrip object that sent this event.
An System.EventArgs that contains no event data.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.MainMenuStripClick(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Event triggered when main form menu strip has been clicked. This event is being tracked to determine how the menu is deactivated. If the mennu is deactivated due to user exiting the menu sugin key events (ESC) or through mouse event then special handling on mouse deactivation is not done to reset focus on this control. If this is not done it results in a deadlock case where the call to set focus in menu deactivate conflicts with the code that is being executed for the given menu option. See EV(324723).
member.param: MenuStrip object that sent this event.
An System.EventArgs that contains no event data.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.MainMenuStripMenuDeactivate(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: When hosting application menu is deactivated then set focus back on to TUC.
member.param: MenuStrip object that sent this event.
An System.EventArgs that contains no event data.

member.name: F:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.components
member.summary: Required designer variable.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.
member.param: true if managed resources should be disposed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.InitializeComponent
member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.
member.remarks:
The size of axR4winCtrl1 and IbmTerminalControl, container control, needs to be idential, currently set to 300,200. If values are diffent then following error will occurr. System.Runtime.InteropServices.COMException (0x8000FFFF): Catastrophic failure (Exception from HRESULT: 0x8000FFFF (E_UNEXPECTED)) at System.Windows.Forms.UnsafeNativeMethods.IOleInPlaceObject.SetObjectRects(COMRECT lprcPosRect, COMRECT lprcClipRect) at System.Windows.Forms.AxHost.SetObjectRects(Rectangle bounds) ..
This component maybe cached by DEVENV process in temp directory if this control was viewed in IDE design time view. In this case the VS ide should be closed and restarted to load the current IbmTerminalControl after it has been installed in the GAC. This will not occur in end user environment, but occurs on dev machine while this component is being modified and rebuilt. It is initially confusing to not see the results of a change. Later on used the debug statement with some changes to confirm the right version of the file was in use.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.WorkspaceName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the workspace providing session services to this instance. If this is undefined or empty, the unique workspace name is used.
member.remarks: The workspace name (also referred to as the channel name) must have the same format as a valid Internet hostname. Names can contain only the ASCII letters 'a' through 'z' (in a case-insensitive manner), the digits '0' through '9', and the hyphen ('-'). No other symbols, punctuation characters, or white space are permitted.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.ExitEmptyWorkspace
member.summary: When set to true, the workspace servicing terminal user instance is closed if there is no terminal instance running in the workspace.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.TerminalTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the time out value (in milliseconds). This is the time to wait for a session to be ready after having called InitInstance.
member.value: The value is in milliseconds. The default value is 15000 (15 seconds).

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.TerminalTimeoutDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the time out delay value, in milliseconds, between checks to see if the terminal is ready.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.HandleMainMenuStripFocusChangeState
member.summary: When set to true, the main form menustrip activation and deactivation event will be tracked to switch focus to or from the terminal user control. If set to false, you will need to add your own MenuStrip Activation and Deactivation event handlers. In the Activation event handler, get the sender Control object and call Focus on that object. In the Deactivation event handler, set the Focus on this OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl object.

notes.para: This value will need to be set prior to calling InitInstance.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.TerminalReady
member.summary: Indicates the state of the terminal instance. See InitInstance for additional details. If the terminal session has been loaded and initialized, then this value is true. If not, it is false.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.Terminal
member.summary: Provides access to the Terminal object.
member.value: The terminal property returned can be null if the terminal cannot be retrieved in a given timeout.

member.name: E:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.OpenSystemsGraphicsTerminalControl.TerminalInitializedEvent
member.summary: This event occurs after the terminal instance has finished loading and initialized.

member.name: P:Attachmate.Reflection.UserControl.OpenSystemsGraphics.TerminalInstance.Ready
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this session instance is ready for use. If there was issues creating the application or the terminal object then this value will return false.
